sentences.english: And surveillance infrastructure can be exported, which also aids totalitarianism around the world.
sentences.chinese: 監視設施可以出口，這也助長了世界上的極權主義。

sentences.english: The Green Book was an exercise, if a daft one, in utopian totalitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 綠皮書就是烏托邦式的極權主義的拙劣預演。

sentences.english: The Chinese govt. supports totalitarians, such as gaddafi, 100%.
sentences.chinese: 中國政府支持極權主義，比如卡扎菲，100%。

sentences.english: The "biggest police state " is the US.
sentences.chinese: “最大的極權國家”是美國纔對。

sentences.english: Europe has a wealth of experience in helping to reform former totalitarian states.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲對幫助極權國家改革具有豐富經驗。

sentences.english: The stress of people exposed to the radiation of totalitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 曝曬在極權主義輻射之下的人們所承受的壓力。

sentences.english: Itwas used by the government to discredit totalitarianism in general.
sentences.chinese: 這是政府慣用的手法來抹黑極權主義。

sentences.english: Questioning Mao's authority was especially dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 向毛的極權提出質疑是極端危險的。

sentences.english: Nowhere was this done more brutally than in the totalitarian states of mid-century.
sentences.chinese: 到處如此，比之中世紀的極權國家來得更爲野蠻。

sentences.english: As long as there are totalitarian regimes in Arab countries, there will be anti-Semitism.
sentences.chinese: 只要阿拉伯國家存在極權政權，就會有反猶太主義。

sentences.english: Free sex, he believed, was the best check on totalitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 他相信，自由的性愛是治療極權主義的一劑良藥。

sentences.english: They feared that totalitarians might yet conquer the entire world.
sentences.chinese: 他們擔心極權主義者會征服整個世界。

sentences.english: The totalitarian ones are both sicker and harder to dislodge.
sentences.chinese: 極權主義者更加病態，更難讓他下臺。

sentences.english: Rather, it is collapse and unification on South Korea's terms.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮廣大人民早已怨恨腐敗無能的極權統治。

sentences.english: Almost all government adopt totalitarian measures in time of war.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎所有的政府在戰時都採取極權主義的措施。

sentences.english: The imposing monolith of totalitarian states often obscures their latent weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 極權國家的龐大外表掩蓋了它們內在的虛弱。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
